alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 4:28AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Somerset and northwestern Franklin Counties through 515 AM EDT... At 428 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northeast of Coburn Gore, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackman, Coburn Gore, Seboomook, Misery Gore, Sandwich Academy Grant, Moose River, Long Pond, Parlin Pond, Merrill Strip, Forsyth, Tomhegan, Rockwood Strip, Soldiertown, Sandy Bay, Johnson Mountain, Skinner, Upper Enchanted, Lowelltown, Taunton And Raynham Academy Grant and Brassua. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
